attributes.action: BRING BACK PUBLIC DRINKING FOUNTAINS, PROVIDE PUBLIC  WITH WATER, REDUCE PLASTIC
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence for the danger of the breakdown of plastic is overwhelming,
both in terms of damage to the environment and the food chain and even in human bodies. This is an unknown health hazard and any efforts to reduce the use of plastic will be beneficial.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-43388870

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution
https://www.lifewithoutplastic.com
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42264788
http://www.sciencemag.org/tags/plastic-pollution
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-018-03104-3
https://plasticoceans.org/the-facts/
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/jan/25/new-network-of-water-refill-points-aims-to-reduce-englands-plastic-waste
attributes.background: The consumption of clean water is a  basic human needs and as such should be freely available to all members of society. There should be clean water available for the public in towns and cities in the UK. Millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills, or decomposing in oceans,fish, then us.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask Parliament to create a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
